Authors: Zhou Meng, Chen jia jia, Josef Vlasák, Yuan Yuan
Title:
Dentipellicula guyanensis sp. nov. (Hericiaceae,
Basidiomycota) from French Guiana.
Keywords:
Hydnoid fungi, Russulales, taxonomy, wood-inhabiting
fungi
Abstract:
A new species of Hericiaceae: Dentipellicula guyanensis,
isolated from French Guiana is described and illustrated based on
morphological characters and supported by molecular phylogenetic
analyses using ITS and nLSU rDNA sequences. D. guyanensis is
characterized by an annual growth habit, resupinate basidiocarps, a
monomitic hyphal structure with non-amyloid, non-dextrinoid and
acyanophilous generative hyphae, presence of gloeoplerous hyphae, and
gloeocystidia, and rough basidiospores measured as 2.83.1  1.92.1 µm. A
key to accepted species of Dentipellicula is provided.
